results.title: Sweet sweetback's baadasssss song (E)
results.brief_description: Starring the Black Community and directed, scripted, edited and produced by Melvin Van Peebles, “Sweet Sweetback’s Baadasssss Song” is one of the most influential of American underground/independent films. Influenced by the radical turn in the civil rights movement, and the resulting rise of the Black Panthers, “Sweet Sweetback …” makes no apologies for its revolutionary ardour. The police in this film are racist and corrupt, white people are murderous and the black population of the United States are still economic and cultural “slaves” to the “Man”. The film’s controversial and subversive power comes from suggesting that the very criminality and sexual licentiousness that racists have associated with the “African”, may be the very qualities the black population can use against their oppressors. Sweetback is a hustler, raised in a brothel. Picked up by the police one night, he snaps when the police begin brutalising a young revolutionary. For the rest of the film, Sweetback is running; running away from a racist America that will not tolerate an “uppity nigger”. Sly, fast and often cruelly funny, the film was made on a miniscule budget and is now unmistakably a result of the counter-cultural ferment of the late sixties. Van Peebles’s work is a pioneering work of Afro-American cinema, and though often considered a precursor to blaxploitation, it is a defiantly angry and passionate work. Features an acid funk music score by Earth, Wind and Fire. The video includes the movie’s original trailer as well as an interview with Van Peebles filmed in the late nineties.

results.title: Sunshine province
results.brief_description: Presents Nelson, New Zealand’s sunshine province, settled in 1841. Shows Nelson’s sporting and tourist activities: public historical buildings, sightseeing, golfing, surf beach as well as Nelson’s agricultural industries including tobacco growing and apple orchards.

results.title: Strong and safe
results.brief_description: A program focusing on IV users and HIV issues in the prison environment. Presents information on cleaning needles/syringes, obtaining new needles and syringes, and safe sexual practices by using humorous narrators - “Bleachman” and “Condomware Woman”! Messages are promoted in a positive, simple and practical manner and are geared to reinforcing safe injecting and sexual practices as they relate to IV drug use and the potential transmission of HIV within a prison oriented context.

results.title: Stroke: the fight back
results.brief_description: Gives careful advice on how to care for stroke victims, such as encouraging daily muscle control pertaining to daily independence with the aid of a visiting nurse, physiotherapist, occupational therapist, speech therapy, medical social worker.

results.title: Strictly white collar
results.creator_credit: Norman Savage and W.D. Scott & Co
results.brief_description: Shows the application of methods-time-measurement to office procedures. The object of methods study is to reduce movement to an absolute minimum consistent with maximum speed and efficiency by eliminating, simplifying combining movements and changing their sequences if necessary.

results.title: Strictly for kids
results.brief_description: An experimental film utilizing children’s drawings cut against a background of child-like sounds. We see signs on walls: “Help!”, “I am Mad!” and “I love You”, mixed with drawings of people, faces, the moon and the sun, fish, crabs and a sinking yacht. Music by Costas, tiles by Gus and camera by Fotis.

results.title: Stress, health and you (TEFC)
results.creator_credit: Herbert Long and Neil Mawby Productions
results.brief_description: Deals with stress and its effect on our health. Dr. Selye discusses how stress can have both positive and negative causes. An overview that helps people to analyse how their own health is modified by stressful events.
